designScenario.name: Advanced AC-DC Power Converter for Next-Gen Aircraft
designScenario.description: This high-performance AC-DC Converter is designed for integration into modern aircraft to supply stable DC power to critical systems under extreme operational conditions. It employs advanced semiconductor technologies for high efficiency and compact design, ensuring compatibility with variable-frequency AC inputs and supporting electric propulsion systems. The converter includes redundant pathways, real-time monitoring, and robust safety features to meet aviation safety standards while minimizing weight and thermal load.

requirements.title: AC to DC Conversion with Frequency Adaptability

details.description: Convert variable-frequency AC input (400-800Hz) from the aircraft power grid to a regulated DC output of 28V.
Support hot-swappable modules to enable in-flight maintenance without system downtime.
Achieve a minimum power conversion efficiency of 97% to reduce energy waste and thermal load.
Maintain transient response time of <1ms under sudden load changes during flight maneuvers.
Implement over-temperature shutdown, arc fault detection, and 2000V isolation between AC and DC sides.
Ensure fail-operational redundancy for critical outputs using dual power paths.
Adopt a modular design with standardized interfaces for easy replacement and upgrades.
Comply with electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) standards to prevent interference with avionics systems.

systemComponents.name: Input Conditioning Unit
systemComponents.description: Stabilizes incoming AC voltage and frequency while filtering electromagnetic interference.

subComponents.name: Voltage Regulator
subComponents.description: Regulates input voltage fluctuations to maintain steady AC levels for conversion.

subComponents.name: Frequency Converter
subComponents.description: Handles variable input frequencies (400-800Hz) to ensure compatibility with aircraft power systems.

subComponents.name: EMC Filter
subComponents.description: Suppresses electromagnetic noise to meet aviation EMC standards.

systemComponents.name: AC-DC Conversion Section
systemComponents.description: Core module utilizing advanced semiconductors to convert AC to regulated DC with minimal losses.

subComponents.name: Rectifier
subComponents.description: Converts AC input into unregulated DC with minimal voltage drop.

subComponents.name: Power Factor Correction (PFC)
subComponents.description: Improves power factor to unity for efficient grid interaction.

subComponents.name: DC-DC Converter
subComponents.description: Regulates the DC output to a stable 28V under varying loads.

systemComponents.name: Cooling System
systemComponents.description: Maintains optimal operating temperatures through liquid cooling and active thermal control.

subComponents.name: Liquid Cooling Loop
subComponents.description: Distributes coolant to dissipate heat from high-power components.

subComponents.name: Thermoelectric Cooler
subComponents.description: Provides precise temperature regulation for sensitive electronics.

systemComponents.name: Monitoring and Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Monitors real-time parameters and controls converter operation for safety and performance.

subComponents.name: Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Measures voltage, current, temperature, and fault conditions.

subComponents.name: Control Logic Processor
subComponents.description: Executes control algorithms to optimize efficiency and fault response.

subComponents.name: CAN Bus Interface
subComponents.description: Enables bidirectional communication with aircraft health monitoring systems.

systemComponents.name: Safety and Protection Unit
systemComponents.description: Safeguards against electrical faults and ensures fail-safe operation.

subComponents.name: Overcurrent Protector
subComponents.description: Interrupts power flow during excessive current draw.

subComponents.name: Overvoltage Clamp
subComponents.description: Limits voltage spikes to protect downstream circuits.

subComponents.name: Isolation Monitor
subComponents.description: Continuously verifies galvanic isolation between AC and DC sides.

relationships.description: The Input Conditioning Unit provides stabilized AC input for conversion.
The AC-DC Conversion Section relies on the Cooling System to manage thermal load.
The Monitoring Unit aggregates real-time data from the AC-DC Conversion Section for diagnostics.
The Safety Unit monitors and enforces protective measures for the AC-DC Conversion Section.
The EMC Filter is a subcomponent of the Input Conditioning Unit.
